name: Jaden Smith
description:
'''Jaden Christopher Syre Smith''' (born July 8, 1998) is an American rapper and actor. The son of [[Jada Pinkett Smith|Jada Pinkett-Smith]] and [[Will Smith]], he has received various accolades, including a [[Teen Choice Award]], an [[MTV Movie & TV Awards|MTV Movie Award]], a [[BET Award]] and a [[Young Artist Award]]. He has received a [[Grammy Award for Album of the Year|Grammy Award]] nomination,{{efn|In [[64th Annual Grammy Awards|2022]], Smith was nominated for the [[Grammy Award for Album of the Year]] as a featured artist on [[Justin Bieber]]'s album ''[[Justice (Justin Bieber album)|Justice]]''.}} and has won two [[NAACP Image Awards]] and an [[Empire Award]].

Smith made his film debut with his father [[Will Smith|Will]] in the 2006 film ''[[The Pursuit of Happyness]]'', and appeared with his father once more in the 2013 film ''[[After Earth]]''. He also co-starred in the remake films ''[[The Day the Earth Stood Still (2008 film)|The Day the Earth Stood Still]]'' (2008), along with [[Keanu Reeves]], and ''[[The Karate Kid (2010 film)|The Karate Kid]]'' (2010), with [[Jackie Chan]]. Following a three-year hiatus, he returned to acting in 2016, starring in the two-part [[Netflix]] series ''[[The Get Down]]'', and voice-acting in the company's anime series, ''[[Neo Yokio]]''.

As a recording artist, Smith first guest performed on Canadian singer [[Justin Bieber]]'s 2010 single, "[[Never Say Never (Justin Bieber song)|Never Say Never]]". Released for ''The Karate Kid''{{'}}s [[The_Karate_Kid_(2010_film)#Music|accompanying soundtrack]], the song peaked within the top ten of the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] and received [[RIAA certification|quintuple platinum]] certification by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA). He later released multiple mixtapes, including ''[[CTV2 (album)|CTV2]]'' (2014). Following a three-year work effort, he signed with [[Roc Nation]] and [[Interscope Records]] to release his debut studio album, ''[[Syre (album)|Syre]]'' (2017). It peaked at number 24 on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]], while his second and third albums, ''[[Erys]]'' (2019) and ''[[CTV3: Cool Tape Vol. 3]]'' (2020), peaked at numbers 12 and 44, respectively. In 2022, he was nominated for a [[Grammy Award for Album of the Year]] as a featured artist on Bieber's album [[Justice (Justin Bieber album)|''Justice'']].
